response: narrative=Ian Stanley, a retired health service manager, went missing from his home at 1 Camdean Crescent, Rosyth. Known for his independent spirit, Ian often spoke about his desire to travel and explore new places, despite his age. On the day of his disappearance, it was reported that he had expressed an intent to visit an old acquaintance in Glenrothes, but he never arrived. Samantha Cox, a friend aware of his travel plans, alerted authorities when he failed to return home. Ian was later found by police at a shelter, suggesting he may have become disoriented during his travels. His close-knit community, including his grandmother, Leanne Johnson, were relieved when he was safely located.

narrative=Ian Stanley was last seen near the library, expressing a keen interest in starting a new life free of constraints. He spoke of planning to sleep rough and was believed to have been involved in a possible boating incident near St Margaret's Head. Concern arose among those close to him, notably his grandmother Leanne Johnson, prompting an urgent search around Pitreavie Drive and other nearby spots, including Jutland Street and Pitreavie Court, before he was finally located safely.

narrative=Ian Stanley, an 87-year-old from Rosyth, was reported missing after he failed to return home from a routine walk. Days later, a vigilant patrol traced Ian to 7 Dollar Grove, Burntisland, safely residing with another friend, having sought refuge from sudden inclement weather earlier.
